Title: Bernstein conducts Britten "Spring Symphony" - LIVE!
Description:
From a 1963 performance at Philharmonic Hall in New York, here is Leonard Bernstein conducting the "Spring Symphony" by Benjamin Britten.  The soloists for this performance were Jennifer Vyvyan, Regina Sarfaty, and Richard Lewis; with the Boys' Choirs from The Little Church Around the Corner and St. Paul's Church of Westfield, NJ (unfortunately not credited in the video itself); the Collegiate Chorale; along with the New York Philharmonic Orchestra.

Part 1
1. Introduction: Shine Out (George Chapman)
2. The Merry Cuckoo (Edmund Spenser)
3. Spring, the Sweet Spring (Thomas Nashe)
4. The Driving Boy (George Peele, John Clare)
5. The Morning Star (John Milton)

Part 2   17:30 
6. Welcome, Maids of Honour (Robert Herrick)
7. Waters Above! (Henry Vaughan)
8. Out on the lawn I Lie in bed (W. H. Auden)

Part 3   29:16 
9. When will my May Come? (Richard Barnfield)
10. Fair and Fair (George Peele)
11. Sound the Flute! (William Blake)

Part 4   35:15 
12. Finale: London, to Thee I do Present (John Fletcher; closing words from ''The Knight of the Burning Pestle'' by Francis Beaumont)

Here's a link to my Jennifer Vyvyan playlist: 
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLBECDBF992D11DF99

And a link to my Regina Sarfaty playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLVaesGflLES9PrznTNqVpT3yeRmkchP60

And a link to my Richard Lewis playlist: 
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL05A18CDF52238531

Title: Bernstein in Budapest - Bartók, Bernstein, Schumann - Bavarian Radio Symphony Orchestra
Description:
Bernstein in Budapest

Leonard Bernstein
Bavarian Radio Symphony Orchestra (Symphonieorchester der Bayerischen Rundfunks)

November 15-16, 1983

Erkel Theatre, Budapest

Béla Bartók

Music for Strings, Percussion, and Celesta, Sz. 106, BB 114 

I. Andante tranquillo (01:30)
II. Allegro (10:46)
III. Adagio (18:41)
IV. Allegro molto (25:46)

Interview with Leonard Bernstein (35:25)

Leonard Bernstein

Divertimento for Orchestra 

I. Sennets and Tuckets - Allegro non troppo, ma con brio (46:02)
II. Waltz - Allegretto, con grazia (47:26)
III. Mazurka - Mesto, molto moderato (49:46)
IV. Samba - Allegro giusto. (51:30)
V. Turkey Trot - Allegro, ben misurato (52:29)
VI. Sphinxes - Adagio lugubre (54:32)
VII. Blues - Slow blues tempo (55:26)
VIII. In memoriam; March: “The BSO Forever” -  Andante — Doppio movimento. Alla marcia — Tutti quanti tutta forza (57:03)

Encore - Turkey Trot and Waltz from Divertimento, with eyes only (01:03:43)

Robert Schumann

Symphony No. 2 in C Major, Op. 61

I. Sostenuto assai - Allegro ma non troppo (01:12:24)
II. Scherzo: Allegro vivace (01:25:40)
III. Adagio espressivo (01:32:59)
IV. Allegro molto vivace (01:46:54)

Encore - Johannes Brahms (orch. Parlow) - Hungarian Dance No. 6 in D Major, WoO 1 (01:58:48)

レナード・バーンスタイン（指揮とピアノ）　ニューヨーク・フィルハーモニック
1976年6月1日　オランダ・フェスティバル、デン・ハーグ　ライブ録音
※1976年のニューヨーク・フィル欧州ツアーから。桂冠指揮者バーンスタインとアメリカ音楽のみで構成したプログラムの後半でした。まさに十八番と言うべき圧巻のライブ。

Title: Leonard Bernstein - Serenade: Gidon Kremer and Leonard Bernstein with the LSO in 1986
Description:
Gidon Kremer performing what is effectively Bernstein's violin concerto with the London Symphony Orchestra at the Barbican in May 1986 under the composer himself. Kremer was supported by LSO leader Michael Davis and principal cello Douglas Cummings.

1. Phaedrus; Pausanius 0:00
2. Aristophanes 07:08
3. Eryximachus 11:41
4. Agathon 20:20
5. Socrates: Alcibiades 24:37

This channel is not associated in any way with the London Symphony Orchestra, or its own CD label, LSO LIVE. These are recordings made by a LSO fan over a period of 40 years from 1977, and are not rips of LSO LIVE recordings. I have greatly enjoyed these performances over the years and just wish to share them with other music lovers. No copyright infringement is intended; please make contact if there is an issue.
